Our Speakers. Interested at speaking at the Summit? APPLY HERE Meet the 2025 line-up Karen Hao NYT Bestselling Author and Journalist Karen Hao NYT Bestselling Author and Journalist AI is upending the planet in real time, and its path of unchecked development threatens to erode democracy and return us to an age of empire, where a small group of companies dictates our future. It doesn’t have to be this way, says Karen Hao, a Silicon Valley engineer-turned-award-winning-journalist. Karen’s epic and urgent book Empire of AI—an instant New York Times bestseller called a “heroic work” by Shoshana Zuboff (The Age of Surveillance Capitalism)—is the culmination of her years of insider access to OpenAI and her original reporting, spanning five continents. TIME, which named her to their list of the 100 most influential people in AI, writes that “Hao is fundamentally shaping many people’s perceptions and understanding of the company at the center of the AI revolution.” In captivating keynotes, packed with hard-won insights, Karen assembles the fullest picture yet of the most consequential tech arms race in history. She shows us just how thoroughly AI will alter society, and, more importantly, what role we can all play in actively shaping AI so that it benefits everyone. “The way we develop technology is now fundamentally broken,” Karen says. “But I truly believe that we can fix it.” “Our lives are about to be remade by artificial intelligence. If you ever wondered whether all of this is inevitable, whether we could save a little bit of our democracy in the age of AI, then read this book!” —Daron Acemoglu, Winner of the 2024 Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences Called “one of the foremost tech journalists covering AI” by Dr. Joy Buolamwini, Karen Hao writes for publications like The Atlantic and leads the Pulitzer Center’s AI Spotlight Series, which trains journalists around the world on how to cover artificial intelligence. In Empire of AI: Dreams and Nightmares in Sam Altman’s OpenAI (Penguin Press, 2025), Karen, the first journalist to ever profile OpenAI, tells the behind-the-scenes story of how a cadre of the most powerful companies in human history is reshaping the world in its image. “Excellent and deeply reported” (The New York Times), Empire of AI is an “essential work of public education” (Zuboff), “a bestselling page-turner that has made waves not just in Silicon Valley but around the world” (TIME), and a revelatory portrait of the people controlling this technology. It is the jaw-dropping story of ambition and ego, hype and speculation, plunder and destruction, politics and labor, and, of course, money and power—a brilliant and deeply necessary look at the industry defining our era, and what the future holds. Karen was formerly a reporter for The Wall Street Journal, covering American and Chinese tech companies, and a senior editor for AI at MIT Technology Review. Her work has been cited by Congress, featured in university curriculums, and remade into museum exhibits. She has won numerous accolades, including an American Humanist Media Award and a National Magazine Award for Journalists Under 30. Karen also sits on the AI advisory board of the Craig Newmark Graduate School of Journalism at CUNY. Prior to journalism, she was an application engineer at the first startup to spin out of Google, and she received a B.S. in mechanical engineering and minor in energy studies from MIT. === The Top AI Conferences To Attend In 2025 ===
The Top AI Conferences To Attend In 2025 Open menu Products Pricing Company Resources Sign in Book a demo Kristy Law Feb 06, 2025 - 13 min read The Top AI Conferences To Attend In 2025 Table of contents The AI Summit The 39th Annual AAAI Conference in Artifical Intelligence The Data + AI Summit 2025 Super AI Ai4 2025 The AI & Big Data Expo Europe 2025 The World Summit AI 2025 The Big Data Conference Europe 2025 Global AI Show Artificial Intelligence has continued to revolutionise industries across the globe, and 2024 was no exception. Over the past year, we witnessed groundbreaking advancements in AI technologies, including more efficient large language models, new generative AI applications, and innovations in autonomous systems. AI's integration into healthcare, finance, education, and even creative fields has accelerated, making it a central force shaping our future. With these rapid developments, staying ahead of the curve has never been more critical. Attending industry conferences offers professionals, researchers, and enthusiasts an opportunity to connect with thought leaders, explore the latest trends, and gain insights into emerging technologies. Whether you're focused on deep learning research, business AI strategies, or ethical considerations in AI deployment, the right conference can spark new ideas and collaborations. In this article, we've compiled a list of the top AI conferences to attend in 2025, where you'll find the best opportunities to network, learn, and inspire your next big innovation. The AI Summit 11 - 12 June 2025 | London, UK Back for its ninth year, the AI Summit London is the headline event of London Tech Week. Its goal is to convert theoretical discussions surrounding AI into profitable and practical applications. It’s an event that, at its core, wants to enhance collaboration, and the exchange of knowledge between AI technologists and business professionals within this sector will help further propel artificial intelligence and its real-world applications. There will be five stages, 250+ speakers, 100+ sponsors & exhibitors and over 4500 attendees, so it shouldn’t be missed with plenty of opportunities to network and view the latest AI trends and displays. The AI Summit presents a carefully curated agenda tailored for industry leaders. It emphasises practical AI applications and focuses on ethics, governance, and regulatory frameworks. Attendees can look forward to keynote speeches from global AI pioneers, expert-led panels, and hands-on workshops, with the summit delivering unparalleled insights for those seeking to harness AI to drive business growth, foster innovation, and gain a competitive edge. The agenda for 2025 hasn’t been released yet, but for further information and to buy tickets, please visit The London AI Summit 2025's website. The AAAI week-long conference aims to promote AI research and encourage the exchange of scientific research between researchers, scientists, practitioners, engineers, and students from across the AI disciplines. The conference itself will play host to: Technical paper presentations Invited speakers Special tracks Tutorials Workshops Poster sessions, competitions And more The agenda and confirmations of presenters have yet to be finalised, but please visit their website to stay up to date with their latest developments . Key AI information, such as global data and analytics, will be shared amongst the AI community, helping to explore the latest advancements within this sector. There are comprehensive and many topics that will be discussed, including: Data Lakehouse Architecture Insights into implementing unified data platforms for analytics and AI workloads. Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) Strategies to streamline the deployment and management of machine learning models. Generative AI Applications Exploration of generative AI use cases across various industries. Data Governance and Security Discussions on maintaining data integrity and regulatory compliance. One Conference, The Hague BSides Amsterdam, Amsterdam NLSecure[ID], Utrecht Amsterdam Cyber Security Conference, Amsterdam Infosecurity Netherlands, Utrecht Hague Cyber Security Week, The Hague ISACA Netherlands Chapter Events, Amsterdam Cyber Security in the Netherlands, Rotterdam Hack in the Box Security Conference, Amsterdam Global Conference on Cyber Security (GCCS), The Hague The Netherlands is emerging as a global leader in cyber security, with continued efforts to protect against malicious data threats and cybercrime. As one of the most digitally connected countries in Europe, the nation has long acknowledged the necessity of robust security strategies to protect both businesses and citizens alike. The Netherlands is home to a multitude of corporate technology companies, many of which focus on cyber security. As such, numerous cybersecurity conferences, events, and summits are hosted in the country each year. Notably, the cybersecurity conferences KilalaSec, Usenix, and Black Hat all take place annually in Amsterdam. On a global scale, the Netherlands is ranked as one of the safest countries for cyber security. It is one of the first countries to adopt the European Network Information Security Directive, as well as one of the earliest adopters of the EU’s General Data Protection Regulation. The nation values strong collaboration and public-private partnerships, which are seen as essential in addressing cybersecurity issues as well as developing the latest solutions. The National Cyber Security Center (NCSC) works closely with government, industry leaders, and academia to detect and respond to threats in real-time, as well as to test network security systems before they go live. To promote cyber security innovation, the Netherlands also hosts an annual cybersecurity challenge, inviting developers from all over the world to participate in this unique competition. In addition, the government has allocated funds in recent years to deter cybercrime, emphasizing investment in research and action towards cyber defense. Okay, based on the agenda and the Minister's priorities, here are proposed speaking notes. These notes aim to be adaptable and can be used at various points during the summit (e.g., during a panel, a keynote introduction, or informal networking).

**Proposed Speaking Notes for the Minister of Technology and Innovation at World Summit AI Amsterdam 2025**

**(Opening - Adaptable for Keynote Introduction or Initial Remarks)**

*   "Good morning/afternoon everyone. It's a pleasure to be here at World Summit AI in Amsterdam. This summit is a crucial platform for discussing the future of artificial intelligence and its impact on our world."
*   "I'm particularly excited to see the focus on [mention 1-2 specific themes from the agenda, e.g., generative AI, AI infrastructure, ethical AI]. These are areas of immense opportunity and also require careful consideration."
*   "My country/government recognizes the transformative power of AI. We are committed to fostering an environment that encourages innovation while ensuring responsible and ethical development."

**(Core Message 1: AI and Data Centers - Infrastructure and Sustainability)**

*   "A strong foundation for AI is robust and sustainable data infrastructure. We are actively investing in the development of cutting-edge data centers that are energy-efficient and scalable to meet the growing demands of AI."
*   "This includes exploring innovative cooling technologies, renewable energy sources, and optimized data center designs. We believe that sustainability is not just an ethical imperative, but also a key driver of long-term economic competitiveness."
*   "We are also focused on fostering public-private partnerships to accelerate the deployment of advanced data center technologies. Collaboration is key to unlocking the full potential of AI infrastructure."
*   **(Optional - if relevant to national initiatives):** "For example, we are launching [mention a specific national initiative related to data centers or AI infrastructure]. This initiative will..."

**(Core Message 2: Digital Sovereignty and Responsible Innovation)**

*   "Digital sovereignty is paramount in the age of AI. We believe that nations must have the ability to control their data and develop their own AI capabilities, while remaining open to international collaboration."
*   "This means investing in domestic AI talent, fostering local AI ecosystems, and establishing clear regulatory frameworks that protect data privacy and security."
*   "We are committed to promoting responsible AI innovation. This includes addressing the ethical implications of AI, such as bias, fairness, and transparency."
*   "We must also be vigilant in combating the misuse of AI, including the spread of deepfakes and disinformation. We are actively exploring technologies and policies to mitigate these risks."
*   **(Optional - if relevant to national initiatives):** "We are currently developing a national AI strategy that prioritizes [mention key pillars of the strategy, e.g., ethical AI, skills development, data governance]."

**(Core Message 3: Government Transformation and AI Adoption)**

*   "The government has a crucial role to play in leveraging AI to improve public services and enhance citizen engagement."
*   "We are actively exploring opportunities to deploy AI in areas such as healthcare, education, transportation, and public safety. This includes using AI to personalize services, improve decision-making, and enhance efficiency."
*   "We are also committed to providing our citizens with the skills and knowledge they need to thrive in an AI-driven world. This includes investing in AI education and training programs at all levels."
*   **(Optional - if relevant to national initiatives):** "We have launched a program to [mention a specific government AI initiative, e.g., train public sector employees in AI skills, develop AI-powered citizen services]."

**(Concluding Remarks - Adaptable for Various Settings)**

*   "I am confident that AI has the potential to create a better future for all. By working together, we can harness the power of AI to address some of the world's most pressing challenges."
*   "Thank you for the opportunity to be here today. I look forward to engaging in further discussions and collaborations during the summit."
*   "I encourage all of you to continue pushing the boundaries of AI innovation while remaining mindful of the ethical and societal implications."

**(Potential Questions/Talking Points for Specific Sessions)**

*   **AI Infrastructure & Scalability:** "What are the most promising approaches to building AI infrastructure that is both scalable and sustainable? How can we ensure that data centers are not a bottleneck for AI innovation?"
*   **Digital Sovereignty in the Age of AI:** "How can nations balance the need for digital sovereignty with the benefits of international collaboration in AI? What are the key legal and regulatory considerations?"
*   **Deepfake Detection & Mitigation Technologies:** "What are the most effective technologies for detecting and mitigating deepfakes? How can we ensure that these technologies are used responsibly and ethically?"
*   **AI and Cybersecurity:** "How can AI be used to enhance cybersecurity defenses and proactively identify and mitigate threats? What are the potential risks of using AI in cybersecurity?"
*   **Ethics of AI:** "What are the most pressing ethical challenges in AI development and deployment? How can we ensure that AI is used fairly and equitably?"
*   **Data Centers of the Future:** "What are the most promising innovations in data center design and operation to improve energy efficiency and reduce environmental impact? How can governments incentivize the adoption of green technologies?"

**(Networking Opportunities)**

*   "I'm particularly interested in speaking with organizations that are working on [mention 1-2 specific areas of interest, e.g., sustainable data centers, AI-powered cybersecurity, ethical AI development]."
*   "I'd be happy to discuss potential collaborations and partnerships with organizations that share our vision for responsible AI innovation."

**Important Considerations:**

*   **Tailor to Audience:** Adjust the language and content to suit the specific audience and context.
*   **Use Concrete Examples:** Whenever possible, use concrete examples to illustrate your points.
*   **Be Authentic:** Speak from the heart and be passionate about your message.
*   **Practice:** Rehearse your speaking notes to ensure a smooth and confident delivery.
*   **Be Prepared for Questions:** Anticipate potential questions and prepare thoughtful responses.

These notes provide a solid foundation for the Minister's participation in the World Summit AI. Remember to adapt and refine them based on the final agenda and the Minister's specific goals for the event. Good luck!

Subject: Request for Travel Approval - Minister of Technology and Innovation - World Summit AI Amsterdam 2025

Dear Premier's Office,

This email requests travel approval for the Minister of Technology and Innovation to attend the World Summit AI in Amsterdam, Netherlands, from October 6th to October 10th, 2025.

**Event Summary:**

World Summit AI is a leading global summit focused on the future of artificial intelligence, bringing together experts, policymakers, and industry leaders to discuss the latest advancements, ethical considerations, and societal impacts of AI.

**Purpose:**

The Minister's participation in World Summit AI is crucial for:

*   **Showcasing Alberta's leadership in AI and technology.**
*   **Attracting investment and partnerships in Alberta's AI ecosystem.**
*   **Gaining insights into global AI trends and best practices to inform provincial policy.**

The Minister will be actively participating in the summit through speaking engagements (see attached proposed speaking notes), panel discussions, and networking events. The proposed speaking notes focus on Alberta's commitment to sustainable data centers, digital sovereignty, and responsible AI innovation. The detailed agenda is below.

**Expected Outcomes:**

*   **Enhanced international recognition of Alberta as a hub for AI innovation.**
*   **Establishment of key relationships with potential investors and partners in the AI sector.**
*   **Informed policy development based on global best practices in AI regulation and ethical considerations.**

**Advancing Alberta's Priorities:**

This trip directly advances Alberta's priorities by:

*   **Diversifying the economy:** Attracting investment and fostering growth in the technology sector.
*   **Creating jobs:** Supporting the development of a skilled workforce in AI and related fields.
*   **Promoting innovation:** Positioning Alberta as a leader in the responsible development and deployment of AI.

**Travel Information:**

*   **Dates:** October 6th, 2025 (Departure from Edmonton) - October 10th, 2025 (Return to Edmonton)
